item.title: Moodboard Pony Adopt [OPEN] Raine
item.media:title: Moodboard Pony Adopt [OPEN] Raine
item.media:description:
Raine is an eathpony who loves cloudy, rainy and wet weather. She is currently in school trying to become a meteorologist and wants to work for her local news station one day. Raine's hair is fluffy and soft like a cloud, gently floating around her, it refelcts her emotions, raining when she is sad and upset and thundering when she is angry! Raine is humble, friendly and very social


PRICE:
   11.00 / 1100 

 You may change anything about the character once it's yours! 
 Don't resell. Ask me about trading first.
 Give credit when you use it and please show me when you do!!!
 Winner gets the original PNG of this art and full credit of the character!
 SERIOUS offers only, don't offer if you can't pay
 Paypal or points ONLY!!!

item.title: Ultra Mario Kart
item.media:title: Ultra Mario Kart
item.media:description:
Ultra Mario Kart is a new installment in the Mario Kart series which is the second Mario Kart game and will be exclusive for the Nintendo Switch, although it will be in other game systems. This game is the direct sequel of Mario Kart 8 for the Wii U and Mario Kart 8 Deluxe for the Nintendo Switch. This game will become the fifteenth installment in the overall series and the ninth in the main series. What’s new to it is the new mechanic called the Trans-kart System, which the rainbow ring appear at various specified points on each track. Once a racer steers their vehicle through the gate, their vehicle will transform into one of its three alternate forms: car, boat, or plane. The form that the vehicle transforms into will depend on the layout of the racing track that lies beyond the ring. The mechanic is similar to the Transformation Gate from Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed. Some of the animations seen for the driver selection process (excluding the new drivers introduced for this game) are ported character models from Mario Kart: Double Dash!! and Mario Kart Wii, with only a few characters receiving noticeable changes.

Theme Song by Panman 14 : www.youtube.com/watch?v=JNh6UX…

The gameplay is like the previous Mario Kart games from Mario Kart Wii, Mario Kart 7, Mario Kart 8, and Mario Kart 8 Deluxe. Tricks, stunts, bikes, and twelve player racing returns from Mario Kart Wii, the hang glider and underwater mechanics return from Mario Kart 7 and vehicle customization also returns from this game as well. The anti gravity mechanic, ATV Vehicles, and Mario Kart TV returns from Mario Kart 8; now there are segways added into the vehicle customization for the body frames. Just like in Mario Kart: Double Dash!! and Mario Kart 8 Deluxe, racers can hold up to two items and just like Mario Kart: Double Dash!!, players get to switch between items as well. Players collect coins to increase their speed just like in Mario Kart 7 and Mario Kart 8 and now the maximum amount of coins in one race they can collect is now up to 20 and when racers get hit by an item or fall in a pit, they'll lose four coins.


Amiibo will work in this game just like Mario Kart 8 and Mario Kart 8 Deluxe. With Amiibo, Players can not just only unlock new Mii costumes with them but can now also unlock new vehicle parts and can also unlock certain characters as well according to what Amiibo the player is using. The Amiibos that are compatible with this game are: Mario, Luigi, Peach, Daisy, Toad, Yoshi, Wario, Waluigi, Donkey Kong, Bowser, Rosalina, Bowser Jr., Diddy Kong, and Sonic. There will also be a new series of Amiibos for this game just like Mario Party 10 which also had a new series of Amiibos as well.


Game Modes:


Grand Prix: Just like every Mario Kart game in the franchise, Ultra Mario Kart  has the Grand Prix as well and works similar to the past three installments. The player will race against eleven computer controlled opponents in four races in one of the eight cups in this game just like in Mario Kart Wii, Mario Kart 8, and Mario Kart 8 Deluxe. There are 3 engine classes from the start: 50cc (easy com difficulty and slow speed), 100cc (normal com difficulty and average speed), and 150cc (hard com difficulty and fast speed). Mirror (same as 150cc but courses are flipped) is unlocked by completing all of the engine classes by winning in first place in every cup, 200cc (extreme com difficulty and extremely fast speed) is unlocked after winning in first place in every cup in Mirror and obtaining 3 stars in every cup in every engine class including Mirror and 200cc Mirror (same as 200cc but courses are flipped) is unlocked after winning in first place and obtaining 3 stars in every cup in 200cc. Players can unlock new vehicle parts by collecting coins in each race and same with the other modes as well or using Amiibo. The point system works the same as it does in Mario Kart 8 and Mario Kart 8 Deluxe.


Time Trials: Once again just like every Mario Kart game in the series, Time Trial mode once again returns in this game.  The player can complete any selected course as fast as possible and beat their own records.


Free Run (New): Free Run is a new mode in the Mario Kart series. It allows players to freely cruise around courses as long as they want to. This mode is recommended for beginners and is a great mode to practice racing on courses. Players also have the options to select which engine class and decide how much computer players can be in during this mode; players can choose up to eleven computer players at once and can set their difficulty to easy, normal, or hard; once 200cc is unlocked, players will now have the option to set the computer difficulty to extreme.

Battle:

Balloon Battle : This classic mode once again returns works the same as it does in Mario Kart Wii, Mario Kart 7, and Mario Kart 8 Deluxe. Racers must use items to pop or steal their opponents balloons to gain points and if racers lose all their balloons, they'll start over and lose some points. At the end of the battle, whoever has the most points wins.

Balloon Thief (New) :This is a new battle mode in the Mario Kart series. In this mode, racers only use mushrooms, triple mushrooms, golden mushrooms, feathers, and stars. The objective is to steal your opponents balloons and at the end of the battle, whoever has the most balloons wins.

Bob-omb Blast: This mode originated from Mario Kart: Double Dash!!. This mode works the same as it does in Mario Kart 8 Deluxe.

Renegade Roundup - A mode that originated from Mario Kart 8 Deluxe.  This mode works the same as it does in Mario Kart 8 Deluxe and this is the only mode which is Team Battle only.  Before the battle, there will be a roulette to determine which team is the offense team and which team is the defense team.

Coin Runners: Originating in Mario Kart Wii, this mode was last seen in Mario Kart 7. Players must collect Coins scattered across the course in order to have the most by the end of the match. Plays more akin to the Mario Kart Wii version of the mode, with players having no limit to the amount of coins they can collect, as opposed to the 10-coin limit in the Mario Kart 7 version.

Shine Thief: Another returning mode from Mario Kart: Double Dash!!, one player must retrieve a Shine Sprite and keep hold of it for about 20 seconds, while the opponents use items against whoever has the Shine to force that player to drop it. The driver holding the shine sprite has a slightly reduced top speed. In Team play, one team must collectively manage to hold on to the Shine for about 30 seconds.

Peepa Panic (New) - The time is set and 3 Peepas will appear and possess 3 randomly selected racers. The rest of the racers will then have to avoid the possessed ones or they will pass the Peepa onto them. Every player starts with 100 points, and their points will start decreasing after being tagged by a Peepa. If they manage to pass it onto another driver, their points counter will start to slowly recover. Having their points reduced to 0 will disqualify them. When the timer has 20 seconds left, 3 more Peepas will appear and possess more racers. The winner is the racer with the most points, or the last one standing when time runs out.

Like in Mario Kart DS,  Missions mainly have the player having to complete a task within the time limit. This includes collecting coins, driving through gates, destroying Item Boxes, etc. There is also a boss stage at the end of each mission set. In each level, there is eight missions total along with a boss stage.

Bosses:

Angry Sun: Use the lightning bolt to stun the Angry Sun and hit him eight times with the Green Shells.

Big Boo (Replaces King Boo due to being a playable character.)

Big Bully (Redesigned to be Bully from Super Mario 3d World)

Chief Chilly

Goomboss

Pokey

Glamdozer

King Bob-omb


Characters:

All base and DLC characters from Mario Kart 8 and Deluxe are present in Ultra Mario Kart. In this game, there are a total of 75 characters.

Returning:

Mario, Luigi, Peach, Daisy, Toad, Toadette, Wario, Waluigi, Yoshi, Birdo, Donkey Kong, Funky Kong, Diddy Kong, Baby Mario, Baby Luigi, Baby Peach, Baby Daisy, Baby Rosalina, Koopa Troopa, Shy Guy, Dry Bones, Bowser, Bowser Jr., Lemmy Koopa, Larry Koopa, Wendy O. Koopa, Iggy Koopa, Morton Koopa Jr., Roy Koopa, Ludwig Von Koopa, Dry Bowser, King Boo, Mii, Metal Mario, Pink Gold Peach, Lakitu, Villager, Isabelle, Tanooki Mario, Cat Peach, Link, Gold Mario, Inkling Girl, Inkling Boy, Wiggler and Petey Piranha.

New Characters:  Goomba, Monty Mole, Paratroopa, Fly Guy, Boom Boom, Pom Pom, Hammer Bro, Plessie, Kirby, Sonic, Captain Falcon, Spike, Kamek, Bob-omb, Kirby, Nabbit, Sprixie Princess, Toadsworth, Pikachu, Harmoknight, Pauline, Cappy, King K. Rool, Paper Mario and Baby Donkey Kong.

Items (A total of 35) :

Item Box, Double Item Box, Coin, Green Shell, Triple Green Shell, Red Shell, Triple Red Shell, Spiny Shell, Banana, Triple Banana, Fake Item Box, Mushroom, Triple Mushroom, Golden Mushroom, Blooper, Boo, Feather, Fire Flower, Boomerang Flower, Super Leaf, Potted Piranha Plant, Super Horn, Bullet Bill, Bob-omb, Super Star, Lightning, Thunder Cloud, Feather, Mega Mushroom and POW Block.

New Items:

Double Cherry: When using the item, it will create a copy of the user, which its in the style of Mario Kart Double Dash where the user drives and the clone will use items by itself.

Blue Shell: The user will go inside the shell, which makes them go faster and knock anyone in the way.

Ice Flower: Allows the player to shoot ice balls until time expires. Affected racers will be frozen in ice for a few seconds.

Magic Wand: The user will be teleport further from where the user was originally located. This can be useful as you can teleport yourself ahead of the person in front of you.

Propeller Mushroom: Propels the user upwards, allowing them to avoid most attacking items or obstacles. It also works as a means to shortcuts.

Coin Coffer: Hops around the racetrack after being released. It will steal racers' Coins when touching it. After several seconds, it will disappear and then reappear in front of the user, giving them all the stolen Coins. This item mostly appears for racers with a low amount of Coins, or no Coins at all.

Poison Mushroom: Can be thrown or dropped on the track. It will start moving around very slowly, looking like a regular Mushroom at first in order to trick racers, and then showing its true form when approached. Shrinks the racer that touches it.

Mushroom Cup:

(UMK) Neon Mario Stadium
Music by Panman 14: www.youtube.com/watch?v=i5fyrT…

(UMK) Toadette’s Cafe
Music by Panman 14: www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZpP-i4…

(Wii) Toad’s Factory
Music by Panman 14: www.youtube.com/watch?v=egaIBp…

(Wii) Coconut Mall

Flower Cup:

(Wii) DK Summit
Music by Panman 14: www.youtube.com/watch?v=wxWOBe…

(3DS) Rock Rock Mountain www.youtube.com/watch?v=oeP-6U…

(UMK) Peach's Castle

(UMK) Bowser’s Casino
Theme from Super Mario 3D World: www.youtube.com/watch?v=fWRMSn…

Star Cup:

(UMK) New Donk City www.youtube.com/watch?v=m-BCi7…

(UMK) Wiggler’s Treehouse (Based on Soda Jungle from New SMB U)

(Arcade) Banana Ruins ( Based on the track from Mario Kart Arcade GP 1 and 2 and DK from MK7 and 8/Deluxe)

(UMK) Shy Guy Express

Music by Panman 14: www.youtube.com/watch?v=qTFcOr…

www.youtube.com/watch?v=tOHwAq…

www.youtube.com/watch?v=m2v2hh…

Special Cup:

item.description:
Ultra Mario Kart is a new installment in the Mario Kart series which is the second Mario Kart game and will be exclusive for the Nintendo Switch, although it will be in other game systems. This game is the direct sequel of Mario Kart 8 for the Wii U and Mario Kart 8 Deluxe for the Nintendo Switch. This game will become the fifteenth installment in the overall series and the ninth in the main series. What’s new to it is the new mechanic called the Trans-kart System, which the rainbow ring appear at various specified points on each track. Once a racer steers their vehicle through the gate, their vehicle will transform into one of its three alternate forms: car, boat, or plane. The form that the vehicle transforms into will depend on the layout of the racing track that lies beyond the ring. The mechanic is similar to the Transformation Gate from Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed. Some of the animations seen for the driver selection process (excluding the new drivers introduced for this game) are ported character models from Mario Kart: Double Dash!! and Mario Kart Wii, with only a few characters receiving noticeable changes.

Theme Song by Panman 14 : www.youtube.com/watch?v=JNh6UX…

The gameplay is like the previous Mario Kart games from Mario Kart Wii, Mario Kart 7, Mario Kart 8, and Mario Kart 8 Deluxe. Tricks, stunts, bikes, and twelve player racing returns from Mario Kart Wii, the hang glider and underwater mechanics return from Mario Kart 7 and vehicle customization also returns from this game as well. The anti gravity mechanic, ATV Vehicles, and Mario Kart TV returns from Mario Kart 8; now there are segways added into the vehicle customization for the body frames. Just like in Mario Kart: Double Dash!! and Mario Kart 8 Deluxe, racers can hold up to two items and just like Mario Kart: Double Dash!!, players get to switch between items as well. Players collect coins to increase their speed just like in Mario Kart 7 and Mario Kart 8 and now the maximum amount of coins in one race they can collect is now up to 20 and when racers get hit by an item or fall in a pit, they'll lose four coins.


Amiibo will work in this game just like Mario Kart 8 and Mario Kart 8 Deluxe. With Amiibo, Players can not just only unlock new Mii costumes with them but can now also unlock new vehicle parts and can also unlock certain characters as well according to what Amiibo the player is using. The Amiibos that are compatible with this game are: Mario, Luigi, Peach, Daisy, Toad, Yoshi, Wario, Waluigi, Donkey Kong, Bowser, Rosalina, Bowser Jr., Diddy Kong, and Sonic. There will also be a new series of Amiibos for this game just like Mario Party 10 which also had a new series of Amiibos as well.


Game Modes:


Grand Prix: Just like every Mario Kart game in the franchise, Ultra Mario Kart  has the Grand Prix as well and works similar to the past three installments. The player will race against eleven computer controlled opponents in four races in one of the eight cups in this game just like in Mario Kart Wii, Mario Kart 8, and Mario Kart 8 Deluxe. There are 3 engine classes from the start: 50cc (easy com difficulty and slow speed), 100cc (normal com difficulty and average speed), and 150cc (hard com difficulty and fast speed). Mirror (same as 150cc but courses are flipped) is unlocked by completing all of the engine classes by winning in first place in every cup, 200cc (extreme com difficulty and extremely fast speed) is unlocked after winning in first place in every cup in Mirror and obtaining 3 stars in every cup in every engine class including Mirror and 200cc Mirror (same as 200cc but courses are flipped) is unlocked after winning in first place and obtaining 3 stars in every cup in 200cc. Players can unlock new vehicle parts by collecting coins in each race and same with the other modes as well or using Amiibo. The point system works the same as it does in Mario Kart 8 and Mario Kart 8 Deluxe.


Time Trials: Once again just like every Mario Kart game in the series, Time Trial mode once again returns in this game.  The player can complete any selected course as fast as possible and beat their own records.


Free Run (New): Free Run is a new mode in the Mario Kart series. It allows players to freely cruise around courses as long as they want to. This mode is recommended for beginners and is a great mode to practice racing on courses. Players also have the options to select which engine class and decide how much computer players can be in during this mode; players can choose up to eleven computer players at once and can set their difficulty to easy, normal, or hard; once 200cc is unlocked, players will now have the option to set the computer difficulty to extreme.

Battle:

Balloon Battle : This classic mode once again returns works the same as it does in Mario Kart Wii, Mario Kart 7, and Mario Kart 8 Deluxe. Racers must use items to pop or steal their opponents balloons to gain points and if racers lose all their balloons, they'll start over and lose some points. At the end of the battle, whoever has the most points wins.

Balloon Thief (New) :This is a new battle mode in the Mario Kart series. In this mode, racers only use mushrooms, triple mushrooms, golden mushrooms, feathers, and stars. The objective is to steal your opponents balloons and at the end of the battle, whoever has the most balloons wins.

Bob-omb Blast: This mode originated from Mario Kart: Double Dash!!. This mode works the same as it does in Mario Kart 8 Deluxe.

Renegade Roundup - A mode that originated from Mario Kart 8 Deluxe.  This mode works the same as it does in Mario Kart 8 Deluxe and this is the only mode which is Team Battle only.  Before the battle, there will be a roulette to determine which team is the offense team and which team is the defense team.

Coin Runners: Originating in Mario Kart Wii, this mode was last seen in Mario Kart 7. Players must collect Coins scattered across the course in order to have the most by the end of the match. Plays more akin to the Mario Kart Wii version of the mode, with players having no limit to the amount of coins they can collect, as opposed to the 10-coin limit in the Mario Kart 7 version.

Shine Thief: Another returning mode from Mario Kart: Double Dash!!, one player must retrieve a Shine Sprite and keep hold of it for about 20 seconds, while the opponents use items against whoever has the Shine to force that player to drop it. The driver holding the shine sprite has a slightly reduced top speed. In Team play, one team must collectively manage to hold on to the Shine for about 30 seconds.

Peepa Panic (New) - The time is set and 3 Peepas will appear and possess 3 randomly selected racers. The rest of the racers will then have to avoid the possessed ones or they will pass the Peepa onto them. Every player starts with 100 points, and their points will start decreasing after being tagged by a Peepa. If they manage to pass it onto another driver, their points counter will start to slowly recover. Having their points reduced to 0 will disqualify them. When the timer has 20 seconds left, 3 more Peepas will appear and possess more racers. The winner is the racer with the most points, or the last one standing when time runs out.

Like in Mario Kart DS,  Missions mainly have the player having to complete a task within the time limit. This includes collecting coins, driving through gates, destroying Item Boxes, etc. There is also a boss stage at the end of each mission set. In each level, there is eight missions total along with a boss stage.

Bosses:

Angry Sun: Use the lightning bolt to stun the Angry Sun and hit him eight times with the Green Shells.

Big Boo (Replaces King Boo due to being a playable character.)

Big Bully (Redesigned to be Bully from Super Mario 3d World)

Chief Chilly

Goomboss

Pokey

Glamdozer

King Bob-omb


Characters:

All base and DLC characters from Mario Kart 8 and Deluxe are present in Ultra Mario Kart. In this game, there are a total of 75 characters.

Returning:

Mario, Luigi, Peach, Daisy, Toad, Toadette, Wario, Waluigi, Yoshi, Birdo, Donkey Kong, Funky Kong, Diddy Kong, Baby Mario, Baby Luigi, Baby Peach, Baby Daisy, Baby Rosalina, Koopa Troopa, Shy Guy, Dry Bones, Bowser, Bowser Jr., Lemmy Koopa, Larry Koopa, Wendy O. Koopa, Iggy Koopa, Morton Koopa Jr., Roy Koopa, Ludwig Von Koopa, Dry Bowser, King Boo, Mii, Metal Mario, Pink Gold Peach, Lakitu, Villager, Isabelle, Tanooki Mario, Cat Peach, Link, Gold Mario, Inkling Girl, Inkling Boy, Wiggler and Petey Piranha.

New Characters:  Goomba, Monty Mole, Paratroopa, Fly Guy, Boom Boom, Pom Pom, Hammer Bro, Plessie, Kirby, Sonic, Captain Falcon, Spike, Kamek, Bob-omb, Kirby, Nabbit, Sprixie Princess, Toadsworth, Pikachu, Harmoknight, Pauline, Cappy, King K. Rool, Paper Mario and Baby Donkey Kong.

Items (A total of 35) :

Item Box, Double Item Box, Coin, Green Shell, Triple Green Shell, Red Shell, Triple Red Shell, Spiny Shell, Banana, Triple Banana, Fake Item Box, Mushroom, Triple Mushroom, Golden Mushroom, Blooper, Boo, Feather, Fire Flower, Boomerang Flower, Super Leaf, Potted Piranha Plant, Super Horn, Bullet Bill, Bob-omb, Super Star, Lightning, Thunder Cloud, Feather, Mega Mushroom and POW Block.

New Items:

Double Cherry: When using the item, it will create a copy of the user, which its in the style of Mario Kart Double Dash where the user drives and the clone will use items by itself.

Blue Shell: The user will go inside the shell, which makes them go faster and knock anyone in the way.

Ice Flower: Allows the player to shoot ice balls until time expires. Affected racers will be frozen in ice for a few seconds.

Magic Wand: The user will be teleport further from where the user was originally located. This can be useful as you can teleport yourself ahead of the person in front of you.

Propeller Mushroom: Propels the user upwards, allowing them to avoid most attacking items or obstacles. It also works as a means to shortcuts.

Coin Coffer: Hops around the racetrack after being released. It will steal racers' Coins when touching it. After several seconds, it will disappear and then reappear in front of the user, giving them all the stolen Coins. This item mostly appears for racers with a low amount of Coins, or no Coins at all.

Poison Mushroom: Can be thrown or dropped on the track. It will start moving around very slowly, looking like a regular Mushroom at first in order to trick racers, and then showing its true form when approached. Shrinks the racer that touches it.

item.title: Time's Revelation Chapter 7
item.media:title: Time's Revelation Chapter 7
item.media:description:
The first chapter where events and setups from previous books really start coming into play, and where I started getting more into building this world, the history behind it and the forces really at play. Plus, a little more adept I hope at combining my own belief system with a fictional setting and not making it sound overtly fanatically religious... as well as starting to provide what I think could be pretty decent explanations in this setting for where the myths and legends of many other cultures could arise from.

Chapter 6: fav.me/dcxfu9p
Prologue: fav.me/dcx10ax
item.media:text:
Ember's Tale'

   The sun was just beginning to break the horizon when we landed back in the village again. The others had managed to dispose already of the dead sea serpent (many, many burn marks and drag lines were in evidence up to the cliffs), and some of the villagers were working on the damaged houses while others tended to the injured and still-unconscious Vikings. Most of the ones who had been hit by the serpent’s energy pulse were awake again, but a handful were still out. Toothless and I landed in front of the Great Hall, where Stoick was waiting.
   “Are they gone?” he asked as soon as we touched down. “N
item.description:
The first chapter where events and setups from previous books really start coming into play, and where I started getting more into building this world, the history behind it and the forces really at play. Plus, a little more adept I hope at combining my own belief system with a fictional setting and not making it sound overtly fanatically religious... as well as starting to provide what I think could be pretty decent explanations in this setting for where the myths and legends of many other cultures could arise from.

Chapter 6: fav.me/dcxfu9p
Prologue: fav.me/dcx10ax

item.title: present moment
item.media:title: present moment
item.media:text:
i wait at breakfast
for the day you'll lean in close enough.
if you ask i'm falling headfirst off a slide in a park in delaware
and i'm four.
i wait, so you'll know why anymore i don't climb and stories
crowd the wings of a silent and empty stage

today, this morning, i mused about the
sleep you haven't yet rubbed out of your eyes -
those green painter eyes
and how, unlike yesterday and probably tomorrow,
both our spoons stir tea left-handed

past a light war by kundera, and past camus murders,
into our future climate scripted by vonnegut.
i look past you, past tea, past yesterday's news to
comic frames that forecast life better than windo
